File libsrc/libgmethod/iir.c

This class has methods for applying IIR filters to TimeSeries objects. The filter algorithms of Dave Harris, LLNL are used.

Public Function Index

new_IIR_fromString (double, const char *)
Create an IIR filter object from a string description.
IIR_methodCreate (const char *)
new_IIR (int, const char *, double, double, double, int)
Create an IIR filter with the specified parameters.
IIR_filter_ts (IIR, TimeSeries)
Filter a TimeSeries object.
IIR_filter_segment (IIR, Segment, int)
Filter a Segment object.
IIR_filter_data (IIR, float *, int, int)
Filter a float array.

Public Functions

new_IIR_fromString 
 IIR new_IIR_fromString(double tdel,
                        const char *s)
Create an IIR filter object from a string description. The string description should contain the parameter names and values in the form "name1=value1 name2=value". The order of the name/value pairs is arbitrary. Defaults are used for values not specified. Example: 
      "type=BP order=5 flow=1. fhigh=3. zero_phase=0"

Parameters:
tdel - input sample time increment.
s - input string filter description.
Returns:
an IIR object, or NULL if malloc fails (logErrorMsg will be called)
IIR_methodCreate 
 GMethod IIR_methodCreate(const char *s)
new_IIR 
 IIR new_IIR(int iord,
             const char *type,
             double fl,
             double fh,
             double tdel,
             int zero_phase)
Create an IIR filter with the specified parameters. IIR if a GMethod object that applies a filter to a waveform.

Parameters:
iord - Filter order (0 to 10)
type - Filter type: BAND_PASS, BAND_REJECT, LOW_PASS, HIGH_PASS
fl - Low frequency cut.
fh - High frequency cut.
tdel - Time interval (seconds).
Returns:
an IIR object, or NULL if malloc fails (logErrorMsg will be called)
IIR_filter_ts 
 void IIR_filter_ts(IIR iir,
                    TimeSeries ts)
Filter a TimeSeries object.

Parameters:
iir - An IIR object.
ts - The TimeSeries object to be filtered.
IIR_filter_segment 
 void IIR_filter_segment(IIR iir,
                         Segment s,
                         int Reset)
Filter a Segment object.

Parameters:
iir - An IIR object.
s - The Segment object to be filtered.
Reset - if 1, reset the coefficients of the recursive algorithm, otherwise continue with the last coefficients created.
IIR_filter_data 
 void IIR_filter_data(IIR iir,
                      float *data,
                      int data_length,
                      int Reset)
Filter a float array.

Parameters:
data - The float object to be filtered.
zero_pbase - Apply a zero-phase (true) or a causal filter (false).
Reset - Reset the coefficents of the recursive algorithm.
